Algonquin College Admission Requirements , English Language Proficiency Requirements, How to Apply, Undergraduate Official Document Required.

Algonquin College Admission for all interested students who wish to apply.

Algonquin College Admission Requirements for International Applicants

Basic Requirements for all students:
• International Application Form (here)

  • Application fee $95 CAD

Couriering credentials
If scanned transcripts are not obtainable please courier them to:

  • International Admissions administrative center (Student Central – C Building)
    1385 Woodroffe Ave, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada
    K2V 1V8.

Admission to Undergraduate official document or Diploma Program (1/2/3 yrs)

One of the following:
1. West African School Certificate/specific Certificate of Education 0 Levels or A-Levels with a maximum grade score of C6 in five relevant subjects (including English)

Admission To Undergraduate Bachelor’s Degree Program (4 years)
One of the following:
1. West African School Certificate/specific Certificate of Education A Levels with a maximum grade score of B2 is necessary to program subjects (including English and Maths)
2. Senior School Certificate with a bare minimum grade score of B in required program subjects
3. A total educational record as well as transcripts for any post-secondary courses or programs accomplished.

Admission To A Post Graduate Certificate Program (1 year)
• Bachelor’s degree and University transcripts (2nd class lower division/2:2 or higher).

Please note that IELTS refers to Academic and not General IELTS

  • EAP –English for Academic Purposes,
  • IELTS – International English Language Testing Service.
  • TOEFL – Test of English as a Foreign Language.
  • PTE – Pearson Test of English.
  • CAEL – Canadian Academic English Language Assessment Test.

How to apply for Algonquin College Admission

  • Confirm your program is open
  • Review Admission Requirements
  • assess Visa/Study Permit/Work necessities
  • Start the Online Application procedure
  • Receive Letter of Acceptance
  • Pay Your Fees
  • Complete a Bridge pre-arrival course
  • schedule and attend International Student Orientation
  • Arrange for travel/airport pickup
  • And lastly, click here
